comments:
Using I200406090800 and the latest UI code from head (plus the patch in 
progress for Bug 64024).  On start-up, I got the following exception: 
 
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception 
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Jun 10, 2004 08:30:57.110 
!MESSAGE inserting org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaPerspective at 2 
!STACK 0 
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: inserting 
org.eclipse.jdt.ui.JavaPerspective at 2 
	at

	at

	at

	at

	at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:96)

sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:638) 
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:622)
The VM then terminated.  This problem is reproducible.

A change to PerspectiveSwitcher by MVM as a fix for Bug 65766 is likely the 
cause.
I think this is a duplicate of bug 66455.
I have filed Bug 66507 to track the SWT issue.
*** Bug 66455 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=11872)
Patch to PerspectiveSwitcher

This is a hack to allow those that need to keep working with UI from HEAD in a
self-hosted session.  This simply removes the offending code.
I didn't see this any more with I200406110010
A fix for this went into yesterday's noon build.
